Well, I'd say that even if nothing matters to you, it might still matter to someone else. So if you are asking if your life has any meaning if nothing matters to you, then no, it does not. Because if your life were to end, you would not care. Because you don't care about what other people think, or at least it doesn't matter to you. But if how other people feel about you matters, then life does matter, even if it's just to make those other people happy. If you have hit the “f*** it” point, and you literally care about nothing in this world, then no, you life does not matter. That's my view. Also, don't judge too harshly, this is my first answer I've ever given to any question on here.

That’s paradox! If nothing really matters to someone in life, then the assertion of *whether does it matter to him/her* must not matter too. If not, then his/her entrenched belief of nothing significant to him/her, is faulty and full of delusion. It can be categorized as a typical case of escapism, in that case. For example, someone isn't bothered what different flavours of chocolates taste like, but deep down in his mind, he is concerned why he doesn’t own a box of chocolates!
